API¶

Kernel¶

class kernel.PIMCKernel(ka)¶

klass klass

__init__(ka)¶

Loads the kernel to the GPU and readies it to be run.

The kernel code from kernel.src is read and modified with the necessary defines and dictionary replacements. The binary program that will be sent to the GPU is built and memory allocations on the GPU are done.

Parameters:ka (kernelArgs class) – An instance of kernelArgs describing what kind of kernel to build.
exceedsLimits()¶

Returns true if information as from getStats indicates a violation of limits. Global memory usage is just estimated based on RunParameters and might thus not be completely accurate.

Return type:bool
Returns:True if limits are exceeded
getAcceptanceRate()¶

Fetches the average acceptance rate in the Metropolis step among all the threads.

Returns:Average acceptance rate.
Return type:float
getBinCounts()¶
getMetroStepsPerRun()¶
Return type:int
Returns:The total number of metropolis steps that will be done in a kernel run
getOperators()¶

Fetches the calculated operator values from the OpenCL device and returns it.

Returns:The mean of the operator values for each operator and walker.
Return type:ndarray with dimension (number of operators) x (number of walkers)
getPaths()¶

Fetches and returns the paths from the OpenCL device.

Returns:The paths
Return type:ndarray with dimension (number of walkers * N * degrees of freedom)
getRunTime()¶

Returns the run time for the kernel to execute.

;returns: Time for kernel to run. ;rtype: float

getStats()¶

Returns information about memory usage of the loaded PIMCKernel. Global memory usage is just estimated based on RunParameters and might thus not be completely accurate.

@rtype: string @return: The information in human readable text format

kernelCode = None¶

String containing the kernel code that will be sent to the GPU.

run()¶

Runs the kernel with the self._system and the run parameters on the OpenCL device.

setPaths(paths)¶

Sets the paths on the OpenCL device.

Parameters:paths (numpy array) – The paths to be set in the device.
kernel.humanReadableSize(size)¶

Converts a size in bytes to human readable form.

Parameters:size (number) – Size in bytes to convert
Return type:string
Returns:The size in human readable form.

KernelArgs¶

class kernel_args.KernelArgs¶

This module defines a single class, C{KernelArgs} which is used to keep track of parameters needed to create a Kernel.
